header.title: Young Women Discriminated Against?
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Age discrimination against women can work in both directions - older women have a hard time finding work, for instance. Maddy says she has it coming from the opposite direction - people attack her online articles based on her youth, saying she lacks the experience to speak on certain subjects. Ana Kasparian of The Young Turks and John Iadarola discuss on TYT University.
header.socioLingVar: Age - General,Age - Over 65s,Gender - General,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments,Age - Youngsters

commentThread.commentText: I do see their point, but being young doesn't mean your wrong in what you are saying. In addition, I don't think being old means you know much. I know a lot of people 20 years + older than me who don't know a god damn thing.

I have learned to be smart enough to be the dumbest guy in the room. Ana you are very right. I got a job by telling my interviewer "I thought I new a lot about [said industry] and I learned I didn't know anything"

She's right.
I'm young too but I'm willing to put my ego aside and admit that I don't know shit...sure, it might be attractive to stupid people that you can talk about anything but if you can't prove it, you're just full of shit...
Dollars to doughnuts she has no idea what a quid is and yet posts on youbube?
omg another video about how hard life is for women... such whiny bitches. Young women have the easiest lives of anyone, except perhaps for the top 1% of rich men in America.
young women are stupid.

To the female spokeswomen: (Yes, you're still a moron.)      I was sincerely perturbed that no evidence was given to support this strong claim of yours that young women "Don't know shit". I was also disappointed to hear you say that in regards to stylistically expressing ourselves as a professional "You can't win". Lastly, what point do you make when you attempt to advise Maddy, and the rest of us, to take age discrimination as constructive criticism and move on? Where is there to move.     Let's put this in another light: Would you give similar advice to a black man who has been rejected for this position?
maybe its because she looks stupid and annoying?

There's plenty of uniforms that women can wear that make you think that they know what they're talking about. If you put on the uniform of a fighter pilot with medals on your chest, I will assume that you know how to pilot a fighter jet.

People are individuals and making generalizations is just ignorant. I didn't have to work as hard in school because I could cheat on my homework using the internet? I never did that. And I was never allowed to use a calculator during a test. You're just assuming that older people work harder with no facts to back that claim up. People should be judged based on who they are not how old they are. The original video isn't even about work ethic, its about the general value of a person's opinions.
ALL young people are discriminated against. If you call up a business saying that you are a new local company and say your like 17, you may be perfectly capable but they won't care.
Criticism isn't discrimination. All people will judge you and you need to rise to exceed their expectations.

What people are doing are "ad hominem attacks". They dont attack the subject/argument text but the person him/herself. Saying that you are "too young" is immature. Argue why her points are wrong instead of being condescending (which these people probably cant ;)).

Older people work harder because they ware raised in a period when you couldn't just download your homework answer, when you couldn't go to an exam with your pocket calculator and had to do the calculations by hand. I admit that my parents worked harder than me to earn a degree.An A+ today isn't worth a C- for yesterday. .

Come on, as a young Assistant Professor I say young students (and female ones) live under a rock. They think having internet access and reading internet articles makes them smart. You live under a rock, move to work with a cab than waste money at the gym. Your generation is a joke. Students in computer class even checked their Facebook during tests.

If you always demand people with the same worldly experience and age you will never get a fresh perspective on things. You can learn something totally new from a small child, wisdom usually comes from the most unexpected places.
I like your bondage picture ;)

I wouldn't say "more likely". I'd probably say less likely if forced to make a sweeping generalization. My point was that it (the quality of a person's thoughts) is simply not something you can know ahead of time based merely on age. I suspect that, for pure mental powers, people probably peak in their early twenties and then gradually decline through adulthood. But that is gradual, and experience counts for a lot. I suspect heuristics increasing replace "thought" wit h age - with mixed results.

Yeah, teenagers/ppl in their early 20s and internet babies (myself included, not talking down to anybody) are more likely to have a more open-minded and "logical" opinion on philosophy and straight up logic, but, as cliche as this may sound, I do believe it's true, there's a very, very big difference between intelligence and wisdom. Introspection on your positions/arguments/debates/ideas from when you were younger are great for getting what I mean.
I'm 36 and still can't break into media. Now I live in a homeless shelter because I ran out of savings and am medically restricted to a desk job.
Everyone is discriminated against.

Think of it like this, if I was to write an article about space and the beginning of the universe and I was saying that the big bang theory is wrong or that God didn't create the earth in seven days. Would you criticize me because I'm only eighteen and am too young to know anything because I am immature or because I am simply wrong about my idea. Age discrimination shouldn't exist, age ha s nothing to do with knowledge nor does it have to do with credibility, if they are correct en the re age won

If I say something that is invalid I want to be told why it is invalid. Not just be shrugged of and told I'm too young. My experience with people who say, "You're too young to understand what your talking about," is that they just aren't intelligent or articulate enough to tell me what it is I am "misunderstanding." Don't tell someone, "You're too young." It's condescending, and to assume that age is really the route of their problem is to not bother to understand the person.
Hooray to you sir!

I absolutely disagree with Ana, not all teenagers think they know it all, apparently she did though. I agree that with age you become more mature, although age doesn't define knowledge or maturity, I have met adults that are about as mature as a 12 yea r old.
I want my drivers lisence but they said I was too young :/    Can I sue them now? :O pleaaasseeee
I am pretty sure a 26 year old Einstein was smarter than the 40 year olds at the time by a whole lot more
You clearly do, though.

Kindergarten kids are not as knowledgeable as junior high students. That is the same idea and yet I don't think many people would flip out about it. You do gain knowledge as the years go by. There is nothing wrong with you and nobody said there is. Someday you will look back and realize how much more you know than you do right now. Just ask your older family members and I'm sure they can relate.

There is an active and obvious disparity between the discrimination that men face versus the discrimination that women face. It's not rocket science unless you live under a rock or perhaps grew up heavily indoctrinated in a religion that teaches sexism as a good thing.

Well it's pretty simple if you have active brain cells 1. The video is from a woman. Shocking that they would talk about the person who made the video's personal experience. 2. The male on the show says he notices it more for women than for men, and in his experience he has seen more age discrimination in women than he has for himself or other men.

A huge majority of young people are like that. I can't think of even one of my friends that hasn't completely changed in the past 10 years of growing up, even though we thought we knew everything about everything. If you're currently young you have no idea how much knowledge and just common sense you will gain in the next few years so it's impossible to realize that you don't know half as much as you think you do.

Who said you live under a rock? People who create/moderate websites probably don't want to deal with backlash from parents or "family groups" if thirteen year olds are viewing content that isn't exactly appropriate for their age. Just like a porn shop isn't going to let you in just because you are mature, neither will every website.

I am thirteen years old, and let me tell you, just stating that has gotten me kicked off a few sites. I hate that being older apparently makes you all-knowing and understanding, but while obviously it does mean you're more mature and more likely to understand some issues, it doesn't mean that a certain person is a complete idiot who has lived their whole life under a rock for being thirteen. Just sayin'.
hence proving the video is needed

One thing the internet has taught me is that this bit of folk wisdom is often wrong. I've enecountered numerous teenagers/early twenties folks on YouTube whose comments and insights are VASTLY superior to the bulk of 40 year shitheads spouting off.

I'm totally feeling this topic. I am subject to age discrimination on a daily basis. Im a 20-something female in the medical field and i get ''abuse'' and comments from my patients all the time, telling me i know nothing and i dont know what i'm talking about, and that i should get a ''more experienced'' person come in for a second opinion. It gets on my nerves like no other.

I guess I'm one of the few people that don't associate age discrimination with senior citizens when I first hear the phrase. When I hear the wor d age discrimination, I associate it with how older people treat me, along with many people I know, have some type of mental illness because we are young. They only go off of age and assume we can't do anything because they know some kids who have participated in various illegal activities and act like they were raised in a barn. It gets really annoying.

Dude, when was the last time you heard that? That distinction of "women and children killed" is almost exclusively used in wartime situations because we assume that they weren't combatants or soldiers. Enemy casualties don't matter. Anna generalises too much based on her personal experience. Just because you were arrogant and didn't really know what you thought you did doesn't mean all young people are like that.

"Men and women make 25 work-life choices that actually create a wage gap. Men make decisions that result in their making more money. Among workers who have never been married and never had children, women earn 117% of what men do. (This factors in education, hours worked and age.)" - Dr. Warren Farrell, *Why Men Earn More*

To be fair, everyone is a moron in their own way. In my experience, women have a tendency to say when they don't know something as opposed to most of the men I know that just bullshit.

Hmmm. Looking at this again, I don't think that you were very fair. I was never claiming that I knew 'everything', or that at 20 I even knew 'a lot' (compared to many decades older). I was merely stating that for the one article they picked up on, age was not a negative issue, yet someone picked up on it. If anything in the article, I was still claiming ignorance on more 'adult' issues, like having affairs. You snipped parts of the video out.

Is not about how fast you processing the data is about how much data you have to process to get to a conclusion. The more data you have to process and analyze the closer you will get to the truth. And in general younger people have less data sets than older people that is why older people tend to disrespect their input. But if you just want to talk about pure mental abilities, why not, you are probably smarter when you were 16-17.

Secondly Most people learn by doing.So giving a young person the opportunity early means they will be less of a "moron"later. The internship idea is based on this principle.

Professional discrimination still exists when particularly sexist people end up at the top of workplace hierarchies, but like you said, this doesn't seem to be very common. To my knowledge, most of the "superficial statistics" (pay gap) is due to societal gender profiling as opposed to workplace discrimination - once women have kids they tend to work/earn less. In a lot of ways, this is still an example of discrimination, but not of the professional sort.

I find the whole issue of women's discrimination a bit of a conundrum. Why? I have never seen any evidence of it. Perhaps this is because I've spent much of my working life in the Liberal Northeast (New York and Boston). I have had female co-workers and bosses. In professional situations they weren't treated any differently. Further, my own research into "evidence" for discrimination has revealed misinterpreted or superficial statistics (see Warren Farrell).

Personally, I think the only time it's okay to make this kind of ' age discrimination' such an overwhelming factor in determining who gets employed or not is when the person is, perhaps, maybe 19 or 18 and below. Otherwise, age really is just a number, making it a lesser factor than experience, education, references, etc, etc. It's a little more complicated than just 'they're right', Ana. I mean, do you know just by Maddy' s age what her experience, education, references, etc, are like?

the third nobel prize went to a woman..awarded by a board of men....kinda disproves your theory that women have been discriminated against. Men recognise talent when it is apparent. Women have been discriminated against since, well, forever. If someone does not believe they are worth anything, they are never given the opportunity to do what they are capable of.. nor would it ever be written down it they did.

You may be able to argue that females have not had documented cases of great accomplishments, but that in no way mirrors their actual ability. Women are equally intelligent as men in every way imaginable. I would not say the sex as a whole is more intelligent than the male sex as a whole, but there have certainly be individuals of each that have risen high above average.

Oh John you can't stop yourself 
"I though you would like that"
and Ana replies
"Oh, I do like it"
or maybe its my dirty mind who framed it that way

Do you really think that is unusual?

Any intelligent young person feels that frustration at some point. Yet those same young people grow up and don't change the views towards intelligent teens. Do you think that's a conspiracy, or do you think that perhaps there is a reason for that?

For disclosure, I am 25. I am not far removed from that frustration.

People get very defensive when you are perceived to be attacking their group. Hence the comments below which criticise Ana for her views. However, she is 100% right. Ana didn't deny that age discrimination exists, just that it was right in some instances. Discrimination against old people is more discrimination against the attributes they tend to have (e.g. less willing to change, more likely to challenge their boss). I honestly don't see that as a problem.

"Don't argue with stupid people. They bring you down to their level and slap you with their experience." Stupid people tend to force the connection between intelligence/knowledge with experience. They feel that because they are older and had more experiences, that they are smarter. It's called research. I haven't had kids and I know how to raise one, based on the examples that I have seen. I hadn't had sex when I was younger and I knew how to protect myself.Didn't need to get an STD to learn.
Scumbag ana

Ugly people are discriminated against, attractive young girls get the best entry level jobs with high pay. This is just plain silly to have a video about a job bias for young girls. I get a video about bias towards older women, but young women bias is absurd. Need proof look at Facebook or go to any college. You also can look at the difference between Ana and Cenk experience ; )

People's experiences are different; some teens may have been through much more than the average adult or maybe they've had a more thorough education. And as we have heard so many times that experience is the best teacher, the opinion of the young shouldn't be dismissed so easily. Personally, when I know that I don't know much about a certain issue that people are talking about, I shut up and listen.

Yet its usually younger people who come up with the most innovative ideas because they haven't become steeped in "experience" and jaded by age, because they don't automatically assume that's "how things work"

Younger people do have valuable things to contribute to the discussion, but there are times when they don't have the experience to realize it when their ideas aren't practical or have the knowledge to know that their "new idea" is actually old and has been tried and doesn't work.

Age counts for nothing if you waste the time you've lived through. The worst argument against an idea is targeted at the person presenting it, and there's no more blatant example of such an argument than criticizing the age of the presenter. If you disagree with a statement or believe its wrong you make your own case for WHY it is wrong.
Something tells me she wasn't hired because she is frightening to look at.

"Worldly experience" and "knowing better now" is a lie we tell ourselves in order to pretend that the random opinions we have now are more valid than the random opinions we held before. That way, when we change our opinions again in a few years, we can just chalk it up to knowing more  than we did before. As opposed to the truth, which is that we just changed opinions for comfortability issues and proceeded to flex our delusion muscle.
its good to hear ann finally admit it. she must fell so much better now

Maybe you didn't know shit Ana... As a young person, you can very easily sacrifice being upbeat and positive (and ultimately naive) for being logical and cynical. You can't argue with sound logic, and you can develop that skill fairly early.
I know a 13 year old who knows more about how the world works than almost anyone I've ever met. Just because you were dumb, doesn't mean you should say all young people are.

I do a Youth Legislature thing where we take over the capitol building for a week. Someone proposed a splendid bill that would require driving tests every 2 years for people over 75. This 55 year old was loudly complaining how it was "age discrimination". Pissed me off. 15 year olds can't drive, but if a 75 yea r old man develops a neurological condition we have to wait 5 years to find out? BULLSHIT!
lol

I was discriminated against. I went to Apple and told them I could run their company but they were like "you don't have enough experience" and I said "Thats experience discrimination you ass!". Corporate bastards...
You don't know jack when you are young. Just the way it is.

She didn't say that the opinions of the youths are worthless, she said that in order to be a good journalist, one could stand to benefit from some more experience. It's not enough to simply have a well-grounded opinion if you want to be a journalist, you have to know how to argue & defend ur points, you have to have a backlog of general knowledge to draw from etc. All this comes from experience. Really, the very fact that you couldn't see where Ana was getting at seems to prove her point...

Ana I'm disappointed. age is irreverent,you should only judge by there action.if I'm debating a 13 year old and they make a point I'm not going to brush it off thinking oh your only 13.that's disrespectful.you should always treat people equally and give every1 the same chance,
Most USA politicians aren't able to differentiate an apple from an orange.. so maybe your brother is slightly above retardation?

It is not a question of what you know. It is having an opinion on issue of the day, and an old opinion is no more valid than a young opinion. Frequently old opinions are jaded & corrupt. They are self-serving. Young people can be more idealistic. They want the world the way it SHOULD be, & that is how we make progress in the world. How about we send all these mature war creators to fight the next war, & leave young people at home to run things. How do you imagine that war would go?
The problem is they move the bar: soon, someone in the 30's will be too young to say shit...

people tend to assume that young people don't have enough "wordly experience." i've been working to help support my family since i was 11, and on multiple occasions i've had people criticize my views on politics (the economy in particular) because they say i'm too young to know what it's like to work for a living. now as an adult i still have mostly the same views, and people take them more seriously just because i'm older.

"you're too young" is code for "i don't respect you."
Nice showing off the legs a little Ana, taking one out of the fox news playbook.
From a job stand point.  How are you going to get experience if you never are allowed to do the job?  The whole job selection process needs an overhaul.

wow anna. the fact that you said that just shows your lack of maturity. Being well-seasoned and mature doesn't come with age. However, it's true that most young people are ignorant. But just because you've never tunneled out of North Korea, doesn't mean you can't empathize. Just because you've never begged for a meal, doesn't mean you can't understand. Clearly, you don't get what the girl in the video said. Instead of making an outright judgement, actually try to understand her problem.
In vegas everyone is discriminated against.... unless your a young woman....
Well, you must be young then because you obviously can't spell.
Your comment demonstrates a lack of maturity which leads me to believe that you or your opinion are not to be listened to.

To be honest at 20, I've learned to humble myself, and learned over the past few years that it's true, at this age you really don't know much. No matter how intelligent you want to convince yourself you are; most people try to tell themselves they're a "special case" or they're different, but no, just no. I've learned that while I may know a bit for my age (I would like to think so, probably not), I have a lot to still learn, so I actually listen to what older people have to say to me.

The "Young people don't know anything" attitude is BS. Some people are just naturally gifted on certain fields. They can form a deeper understanding of a topic much faster than others.
